timeline.bodyText:
LinkedHashLruCache is guarded by CachingRlsLbClient.lock.
LinkedHashLruCache.evictionListener.onEviction() is guarded by LinkedHashLruCache.lock.
There could be deadlock:
LinkedHashLruCache.cache() -> evictionListener.onEviction() -> value.cleanup()

replies.bodyText:
i am not saying it is logically different (i said they are same).
you can express 2 ways to say at least one value exists using xor. a^b^c except 1 case where all has value. or, you can say a^b^c works when at least one is no value. i found out the 1st is easier to understand because maybe how i memorize the xor truth table. if you says the later one is equally easy to understand i am fine changing it, but just trying to avoid double negation defeat the purpose why it suggest that; it usually makes the logic harder to understand.
